intro: Hieracium crocatum subsp. valdefrondosum, commonly known as the Valdefrondos hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. The plant has basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape, with hairy surfaces. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and are characteristic of the hawkweed genus. It is known for its robust growth and ability to thrive in harsh environmental conditions.
